sentence: The contest for governor will feature the Democratic Attorney General Ben Shapiro and GOP State Sen. Doug Mastriano, another Republican endorsed by Trump.

title: Party primaries test power of Trumps backing and progressive platform

sentence: It helped Pennsylvanias Doug Mastriano claim a double-digit victory in his Republican gubernatorial race.

sentence: Republicans have already elevated candidates like State Senator Doug Mastriano, a far-right 2020 election denier who is the Republican nominee for governor in Pennsylvania.
title: Democrats Fight Headwinds in Georgia and Beyond: The Problem Is Reality

sentence: The races are being closely watched to see if more far-right candidates across the country can follow in the footsteps of Doug Mastriano, who won Pennsylvania's Republican primary race for governor last week by running a campaign focused on pushing Trump's election falsehoods.
author: Daniel Bush
title: Georgia Primaries Will Test Trump's Revenge Campaign Against GOP Incumbents

sentence: During the Republican primary in Pennsylvania, Mr. Shapiro, the state's attorney general, ran an ad that called State Senator Doug Mastriano one of Donald Trump's strongest supporters.
title: Democrats are mindful of headwinds in Georgia, and everywhere else.

sentence: Pennsylvania Republicans last week chose as their gubernatorial nominee Doug Mastriano, a state senator who marched on the Capitol on Jan. 6 and who wrote his master's thesis on the need for the military to protect the country from a Hitlerian Putsch by the left, The Post's Greg Jaffe reported.

sentence: Trump has scored some primary victories with election deniers most significantly last week in Pennsylvania, when Republican voters there chose his preferred gubernatorial candidate Doug Mastriano, who said he wouldn't have certified Biden's 2020 win of the state.
title: Takeaways: Trump's big primary defeat; scandals for the win
